did.unittitle: New England Canal Ledgers and Charlestown Ledgers

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into five series by subject matter and contain 11 ledgers, mostly from the early to mid- nineteenth century. The five series are: Middlesex Canal, Ledgers, 1808-1846; Union Canal, Ledgers, 1850-1851; Bow Canal, Ledgers, 1809-1853; Charlestown Records, Ledgers, ca. 1800's; Miscellaneous, Ledgers, 1827-1863.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The material was found together and uncatalogued in the stacks in the summer of 2007. They are of unknown provenance.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Ledgers are of unknown provenance. It was decided to keep the items together in case there are connections between the ledgers. Most ledgers have original titles. Titles added by archivist are indicated by square brackets. Processed by: Ashley Gaunt, winter 2007; supervised by: Susanne Belovari

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a number of nineteenth-century ledgers. Most ledgers cover the activities of various canals in the northeastern United States. Two ledgers cover events of Charlestown, Massachusetts. One of those consists of handwritten summaries and citations of historical records from 1628-1641. Also noteworthy are ledgers listing the contents of ships traveling the Middlesex Canal.

The Middlesex Canal, built between 1793 and 1803, was an important transportation system in Massachusetts during the first half of the nineteenth century. Ceasing operation in 1853, the canal was a central part of the industrial, commercial and economic landscape. The Bow Canal, begun in New Hampshire in 1812, was also a main transportation route for the New England area. It stretched from Boston, Massachusetts to Manchester, New Hampshire. The Union Canal of Pennsylvania was an attempt to unify the economic ventures of the state via a principal travel route. It is one of the oldest existing transportation tunnels in the United States and was officially completed in 1828 by Canvass White, one of the chief engineers of the Erie Canal. Charlestown, Massachusetts, was first established on Shawmut Peninsula, just north of Boston, around 1629.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains ledgers that cover the activities of the Middlesex Canal in Massachusetts. Dates range from the early to mid- 19th century. Most of the material describes the expenditures of the canal as well as the contents of various shipments traveling the canal.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged by ledger's subject matter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains ledgers that cover the activities of the Union Canal of Pennsylvania. The dates range from 1850-1851. The bulk of the material covers the expenditures and accounts of the canal.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged based on the subject matter of the ledgers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains ledgers that detail the activities of the Bow Canal in New Hampshire. The dates range from 1809-1853. Most of the material lists the accounts and expenditures of the canal.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged based on the subject matter of the ledgers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series covers the events and history of Charlestown, Massachusetts. The dates are primarily from the 1800's, but a bulk of the material covers the early history of Charlestown. Most of the other material is from 1833-1846.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged based on the subject matter of the ledgers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains a few miscellaneous ledgers. The dates range from 1827-1863. Most detail expenditures and accounts relating to business matters. Some of the subject matter is unclear.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged based on the subject matter of the ledgers.
